content.description: Crouch start with some low jugs and a far left foothold. Move up and right onto super slick calcium coated jugs, then top out whenever you reach the lip.

Start as for Grandview Arete (left hand sidepull, right hand chunky edge), move left into Buena Vista, then traverse further left into the crimps of Aura. Finish as for Aura. Last move is crux. Power-endurance crimping.

Hard to grade this one because all the hard moves are in the second half
content.protection: 4+ pads for full protection, but the beginning is low and not too hard
content.location: On the arete with a left sidepull and right hand chunky edge.

content.description: Start as for Aura (sit start on rock bench with left hand edge and right hand sidepull), then make a few crimpy moves into the undercling of Buena Vista. Top out as for Buena Vista.
content.protection: 2+ pads and a slider for the start
content.location: Flat rock bench on the left end of the overhanging face.

content.description:
Start as for Grandview Arete (left hand sidepull, right hand chunky edge), bust to a slopey edge, then make your way into the big crimp-jug that you go to for the first move of Buena Vista.

For me, this added 5 moves to the regular start and made the top a bit pumpier.

I also think this might be the best line on the boulder.
content.location: Backside of boulder on the arete.

content.description: Sit start from a left sidepull, chunky right hand edge. Climb up to a cruxy move to a small righthand sidepull. From here up the difficulty eases but the climb becomes more committing.

Start as for Aura (sit start on rock bench, left hand edge, right hand crimp sidepull), make a few crimpy moves into the undercling of Buena Vista, then continue right to finish as for Grandview Arete.

This is basically a sit start for Buena Vista Derecha and a link-up/traverse of 3 established lines.
content.protection: 3+ pads and a slider pad for the start
content.location: Rocky bench on the left end of the face

content.description: Leftmost route on the boulder, best rock on boulder, good moves. Start matched on a rounded sidepull jug feature with good feet. Climb up through sidepulls and good edges to a pumpy topout. I dont know who cleaned and probably climbed this thing, but it is quite good.

Start as for Buena Vista on the undercling feature, then move left into the crimps of Aura V3. This start makes the crux of Aura much harder, and the dabby part is even dabbier.

This one is tough to grade, but it felt harder than all theÂ  other V5-6s on the boulder.
content.location: Big undercling feature of Buena Vista, in the middle of the face.

content.description: Start as for Buena Vista (stand start on undercling feature), then link into the top half of Grandview Arete. Adds a new crux move to get around onto the right side of the arete.
content.location: Center of boulder on big undercling.

content.description: Start from cool undercling feature and climb straight up via sharp sidepulls and edges

Start sitting on the rock bench with a good left hand edge, a right hand sidepull crimp, and some big but dabby footholds. Hit some crimps overhead and left, then make a big cross-over move to a huge jug further on the left.

This thing was very cryptic. There's a lot of crimps but the angle of the crimps and the requisite body positioning makes most of them very hard to move from.
content.protection: 2+ pads and a slider pad for the start
content.location: Middle of boulder right in front of the flat rock "bench."
